body_html:
@aselle I have the same problem. Here is my code.

import string
from io import BytesIO
import base64
import numpy as np
from keras.models import load_model
from keras import backend as K
from scipy import misc

characters = string.digits + string.ascii_lowercase + ' '
width, height, n_len = 170, 60, 8
base_model = load_model('model.h5')

def predict(img_base64=None):
    pfd = BytesIO(base64.b64decode(img_base64))
    img = misc.imread(pfd, mode='RGB')
    img = misc.imresize(img, (height, width))
    img = img.transpose(1, 0, 2)
    img = img.reshape(1, width, height, 3)
    y_pred = base_model.predict(img)
    y_pred = y_pred[:, 2:, :]
    ctc_code = K.ctc_decode(y_pred, input_length=np.ones(y_pred.shape[0]) * y_pred.shape[1])
    out = K.get_value(ctc_code[0][0])
    out = out[:, :n_len]
    out = np.array(out, dtype=np.int8)
    out = ''.join([characters[x] for x in out[0]])
    return out

After the function predict called abouts hundreds of times, it slows down, momery just keep going up.

body:
@aselle I have the same problem.  Here is my code.

```
import string
from io import BytesIO
import base64
import numpy as np
from keras.models import load_model
from keras import backend as K
from scipy import misc

characters = string.digits + string.ascii_lowercase + ' '
width, height, n_len = 170, 60, 8
base_model = load_model('model.h5')

def predict(img_base64=None):
    pfd = BytesIO(base64.b64decode(img_base64))
    img = misc.imread(pfd, mode='RGB')
    img = misc.imresize(img, (height, width))
    img = img.transpose(1, 0, 2)
    img = img.reshape(1, width, height, 3)
    y_pred = base_model.predict(img)
    y_pred = y_pred[:, 2:, :]
    ctc_code = K.ctc_decode(y_pred, input_length=np.ones(y_pred.shape[0]) * y_pred.shape[1])
    out = K.get_value(ctc_code[0][0])
    out = out[:, :n_len]
    out = np.array(out, dtype=np.int8)
    out = ''.join([characters[x] for x in out[0]])
    return out
```

After the function `predict` called abouts hundreds of times, it slows down, momery just keep going up.
